comments:
I went through the Web project creation wizard, creating a runtime at the same time. Everything worked fine. I then renamed the server runtime in Preferences > Server > Installed Runtimes and tried to create another Web project. The first page won't even appear and the following exception is in the .log:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2005-11-22 09:30:24.644
!MESSAGE Could not find runtime Apache Tomcat v5.0.
!STACK 0
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Could not find runtime Apache Tomcat v5.0.

Same is true if the user ever deletes an existing runtime.
*** Bug 117939 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

(In reply to comment #2)
> *** Bug 117939 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
> 

Kostin,
Although both bugs relate to the absence of a server runtime causing problems I don't think they are the same bug - one relates to subsequently creating projects (this), the other to importing projects (117939.  I'm therefore not sure 117939 should be considered a dupe - fixing this one won't resolve 117939.  

Also, note, 117939 related bug pertained to M7, before the facet code was introduced, nor am I seeing any IlegalArgumentException when debugging 117939...
Setting priority to P2 since this is a Hot Bug.
*** Bug 119573 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Fixed. Note that this only fixes the exception and makes it possible for the user to correct the situation. The general problem of better handling the changes that are required as runtimes come and go and mutate is handled separately.
By 'is handled separately', do we already have another bug for management and syncing changes so that the user doesn't have to make changes in multiple places, or should I open one?
I was refering to Bug 117939 and Bug 119778. What are you referring by "making change in multiple places"?
Yes, tThat's what I meant. I think those bugs cover it.

traces.message: Could not find runtime Apache Tomc
